virtual_robot.controller.robots.classes

Class TwoWheelBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • virtual_robot.controller.VirtualBot
      • virtual_robot.controller.robots.TwoWheelBot

  • public class TwoWheelBot
extends VirtualBot
    For internal use only. Represents a robot with two standard wheels, color sensor, four distance sensors, a Gyro Sensor, and a Servo-controlled arm on the back. TwoWheelBot is the controller class for the "two_wheel_bot.fxml" markup file.

    • Field Summary

      • updateStateAndSensors

        public void updateStateAndSensors(double millis)
        Description copied from class: VirtualBot
        Update the state of the robot. This includes the x, y, and headingRadians variables, as well other variables that may need to be updated for a specific robot configuration. Also, update the robot's sensors by calling the update.. methods of the sensors (e.g., the updateDistance(...) method of the distance sensors). updateStateAndSensors is called on a non-UI thread via an ExecutorService object. For that reason, it SHOULD NOT make changes to the robot's graphical UI. Those changes should be made by overriding the updateDisplay() method, which is run on the UI thread.
        Specified by:
        updateStateAndSensors in class VirtualBot
        Parameters:
        millis - milliseconds since the previous update

      • updateDisplay

        public void updateDisplay()
        Description copied from class: VirtualBot
        Update the display based on the current x, y, and headingRadians of the robot. This method is run on the UI thread via a call to Platform.runLater(...). For most robot configurations, it will be necessary to override this method, so as to implement graphical behavior that is specific to an individual robot configuration. When overriding updateDisplay(), the first statement of the override method should be: super.updateDisplay().
        Overrides:
        updateDisplay in class VirtualBot

      • powerDownAndReset

        public void powerDownAndReset()
        Description copied from class: VirtualBot
        Stop all motors; De-initialize or close other hardware (e.g. gyro/IMU) as appropriate.
        Specified by:
        powerDownAndReset in class VirtualBot
